# Snow-Flow - Complete AI Context

> The #1 AI-powered ServiceNow development platform. 410+ MCP tools across 23 servers.

## Overview

Snow-Flow is the leading open-source framework for AI-assisted ServiceNow development. Created by GroeimetAI (Netherlands), it enables any Large Language Model to interact directly with ServiceNow instances through the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

**Mission**: Make ServiceNow development faster, more accessible, and AI-native while maintaining enterprise security standards.

## Architecture

### Core Components

1. **Snow-Flow (Open Source)**
   - 410+ MCP tools across 23 specialized servers
   - ES5 validation (ServiceNow uses Rhino engine)
   - Automatic Update Set management
   - Local IDE integration
   - GitHub: https://github.com/groeimetai/snow-flow

2. **Snow-Code (CLI/TUI)**
   - Interactive terminal interface
   - Multi-model configuration (75+ providers)
   - OAuth device flow authentication
   - Session management

3. **Snow-Flow Enterprise**
   - Additional MCP servers (Jira, Azure DevOps, Confluence)
   - Stakeholder seats (read-only access)
   - SSO integration (SAML, OIDC)
   - SOC 2 & ISO 27001 compliance
   - Portal: https://portal.snow-flow.dev

## MCP Tool Categories

### Core ServiceNow Operations
- `snow_query_table` - Query any ServiceNow table with encoded queries
- `snow_create_record` - Create records in any table
- `snow_update_record` - Update existing records
- `snow_delete_record` - Delete records
- `snow_get_record` - Retrieve single records by sys_id

### Script Execution
- `snow_execute_background_script` - Run server-side scripts (ES5 only!)
- `snow_execute_script_with_output` - Execute with output capture
- `snow_trace_execution` - Performance tracing

### Development Artifacts
- `snow_create_business_rule` - Create business rules
- `snow_create_script_include` - Create reusable Script Includes
- `snow_create_client_script` - Client-side scripts
- `snow_create_ui_policy` - UI policies
- `snow_create_ui_action` - UI actions

### Widget Development
- `snow_deploy` - Deploy widgets with coherence validation
- `snow_update` - Update existing widgets
- `snow_preview_widget` - Preview before deployment
- `snow_widget_test` - Test widget functionality

### Update Set Management
- `snow_update_set_create` - Create update sets
- `snow_update_set_switch` - Switch active update set
- `snow_update_set_complete` - Mark as complete
- `snow_update_set_export` - Export as XML

### Flow Designer
- `snow_flow_create` - Create flows
- `snow_flow_add_action` - Add flow actions
- `snow_flow_test` - Test flow execution

### CMDB & ITSM
- `snow_cmdb_search` - Search Configuration Items
- `snow_query_incidents` - Query and analyze incidents
- `snow_create_change` - Create change requests
- `snow_knowledge_search` - Search knowledge base

### Integrations (Enterprise)
- `jira_create_issue` - Create Jira issues
- `jira_sync_story` - Sync ServiceNow stories to Jira
- `azdo_create_work_item` - Azure DevOps work items
- `confluence_create_page` - Create Confluence pages

## Key Differentiators vs ServiceNow Build Agent

| Feature | Snow-Flow | Build Agent |
|---------|-----------|-------------|
| AI Providers | 75+ (any LLM) | 4 integrated |
| Development Environment | Any IDE, terminal | Browser only |
| MCP Tools | 410+ standard protocol | Proprietary API |
| External Integrations | Jira, Azure DevOps, Confluence | ServiceNow only |
| Pricing | Free core + Enterprise | Per-user licensing |
| Open Source | Yes (MIT) | No |

## Installation & Setup

### Quick Start
```bash
# Install and run
npx snow-flow

# Or with npm
npm install -g snow-flow
snow-flow start
```

### Configuration
Snow-Flow uses `~/.snow-flow/config.json` for settings:
- ServiceNow instance credentials
- AI provider API keys
- MCP server selection
- Enterprise license (optional)

### MCP Client Integration
Works with any MCP-compatible client:
- Claude Desktop
- Cursor
- VS Code (with MCP extension)
- Custom implementations

## ServiceNow Compatibility

### Supported Versions
- Tokyo, Utah, Vancouver, Washington, Xanadu
- Both SaaS and on-premise instances

### ES5 Requirement
ServiceNow runs on Mozilla Rhino (ES5). Snow-Flow:
- Validates all scripts for ES5 compatibility
- Provides automatic ES6→ES5 conversion
- Warns on incompatible syntax

### Scoped Applications
Full support for:
- Global scope
- Application scoped development
- Update Set segregation

## Security & Compliance

### Authentication
- OAuth 2.0 device flow
- Basic auth (legacy)
- SSO integration (Enterprise)

### Enterprise Certifications
- SOC 2 Type II (Enterprise)
- ISO 27001 (Enterprise)
- GDPR compliant

### Data Handling
- No data storage (pass-through architecture)
- Encrypted credentials (AES-256 or GCP KMS)
- Audit logging
